title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro 13.3" - Early 2011 both USB ports dead / not working - no liquid damage
message:
[PLAIN][SOLVED]MacBook Pro 13.3" - Early 2011 both USB ports dead / not working - no liquid damage[/PLAIN]

Working on a MacBook Pro 13.3" - Early 2011 logic board that has both USB ports dead.  

Everything else seems to work properly and it's otherwise a very normal A1278.  Inspection under a scope shows absolutely no signs of liquid damage, obvious burns on the board or probe points.

On both USB ports I get a good 5v on pin 1.  Pin 3 on both USB ports are idle until something is plugged in then they switche to 3v.  

Also.... I have the schematic for this model but not a "location" guide showing the placement of the various chips.  Any help would be appreciated.

title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro 13.3" - Early 2011 both USB ports dead / not working - no liquid damage
message: Usually bad L4600/10 in the data lines, test continuity.

title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro 13.3" - Early 2011 both USB ports dead / not working - no liquid damage
message: You wouldn't happen to have a layout showing the location of L4600/10would you ?  I have the actual schematics but not the diagram showing actual ship locations.

title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro 13.3" - Early 2011 both USB ports dead / not working - no liquid damage
message: What you're looking for is a boardview and openboardview software. Google it.

title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro 13.3" - Early 2011 both USB ports dead / not working - no liquid damage
message: That was it, bad L4610.  Replaced and both USB ports are up and running fine now.  Thanks for the help.
